jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)in a state of agitation or excitement

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a verb): imitative

entry.def: When birds twitter, they make a lot of short high-pitched sounds.

example.ex: There were birds twittering in the eucalyptus trees.
example.tran: 桉树上鸟儿在吱吱喳喳地叫。
枝头落满了啁啾鸟雀的树

entry.def: If you say that someone is twittering about something, you mean that they are speaking about silly or unimportant things, usually rather fast or in a high-pitched voice.

example.ex: ...debutantes twittering excitedly about Christian Dior dresses...
example.tran: 嘁嘁喳喳兴奋地谈论着克里斯汀·迪奥女装的初入社交界的富家小姐们

example.ex: She laughs, blushes and twitters: 'Oh, doesn't Giles have just the most charming sense of humour?'
example.tran: 她羞赧地笑了，尖声细气地说道：“哦，难道贾尔斯的幽默感不正是特招人喜欢的那种吗？”

means.word_mean: 1. make high-pitched sounds, as of birds
